intro: Astronia maquilingensis, commonly known as the Maquiling astronia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four or five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
